This work with Dr. Barbara Abrams is an application of GEE models to longitudinal BMI measurements over a woman's lifetime, accounting for the timing and number of births they had in their lifetime.

**Product** 

[Abrams, B., Heggeseth, B., Rehkopf, D., & Davis, E. (2013). Parity and body mass index in US women: a prospective 25‐year study. Obesity, 21(8), 1514-1518.](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/oby.20503)
